Dialogue.NPCText:
You find a thin, hunched man wrapped in a hooded shroud, his gloved fingers nervously twisting a blackened quill. Arcane glyphs stain his sleeves and the corners of his eyes dart to shadowed corners.

He leans in, whispering, as if even the walls might listen.
"Quiet! Tread softly… the words here have ears, and the ink is always watching. Nolgrim, Archivist—at your peril. If you seek tales, be sure they don’t seek you in return…"

Option.text: You seem nervous. Is something wrong?
Archivist of what, exactly?
Have you always lived in Frostmere?
I only wanted to browse your collection.
Tell me more about your life before Frostmere.
I’ll leave you to your books.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nolgrim’s gloved hands flutter.

"Wrong? Hah! Wrong is the normal here. Between Kaelen’s reckless scribbling, Irinya’s dream-thieving, and the Obelisk humming secrets to itself, this whole place is a library on the edge of burning.

I catch words crawling under doors, see sentences rearrange when my back is turned. Trust nothing written after midnight, and never trust a mage with cold hands."

Option.text: Why do you distrust Kaelen and Irinya?
Maybe you need some assistance?
Are your books actually dangerous?
I’ll come back another time.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Archivist of… everything best left forgotten. Forbidden grimoires, ice-etched prophecy, relics that hunger for readers. You want farming tips, go to Svala. You want secrets that shatter minds, ask Nolgrim… if you’re certain you’ll want the answers."

Option.text: What’s the rarest book you keep?
Is any text missing from your vault?
I should go.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He shifts uncomfortably, glancing at the shadows.
"Moonglow cast me out, said I was obsessed with ‘malignant lore’—fools, all of them. I know more about magical ink than any Archmage alive. When the sky burned and Minax’s beasts swept through the Isles, I took my books and my gloves and I ran. Frostmere welcomed the desperate—now I’m the only thing keeping this village’s past from swallowing its future."

Option.text: Do you get along with the others here?
You seem to know a lot about magical dangers.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nolgrim glares suspiciously.
"Nothing here is for idle eyes. Half the books bite, and the rest would sooner convince you to set them free. If you must read, read the sky. It’s safer."

Option.text: Is something missing from your collection?
Very well, I’ll go.

Dialogue.NPCText:
His voice drops to a bitter hiss.
"Kaelen is a hazard with a quill—brilliant, yes, but one day he’ll freeze the words right off the page. I watch him closely, copy his journals in secret, just in case.
And Irinya? She… erases. Not with fire, nor frost—she just *dreams* whole histories away. Pages go blank after she visits. I padlock my shelves at night, but I still hear the scratching in my sleep…"

Option.text: Is there anything I could do to help protect your vault?
You sound troubled by both. Why stay?
I’ll leave you to your work.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nolgrim shrugs, looking almost proud.
"Because someone must remember, even if the remembering hurts. And because, in the end, knowledge is its own armor—unless it eats you first."

Option.text: Maybe I can help guard your knowledge.
I wish you luck, Nolgrim.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Are the books dangerous? Are wolves dangerous? At least wolves don’t whisper promises in your ear.

I have bound tomes with living ink, texts that feed on memory, scrolls written by the hand of Minax herself. Most I keep locked in cold iron, but one…

One escaped. Or rather, was stolen—by a thing of frost and hate."

Option.text: Tell me more about this thief.
Sounds risky—I’ll pass.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nolgrim leans in, eyes bright.
"The ‘Lexicon Frigidus’—a grimoire bound in winter wolf hide, written in runes that shimmer and crawl. Only opens beneath aurora light. If you ever find a page torn from it, bring it to me… I’ll reward you well. But never read it. Not unless you want your soul to shiver for a century."

Option.text: Is this book connected to your missing volume?
Understood. No reading forbidden books.

Dialogue.NPCText: Nolgrim gives a curt nod, his fingers unconsciously tracing arcane sigils in the air.

Option.text: Do you need help recovering anything?
I’ll leave now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nolgrim’s whisper grows urgent.
"Yes—help. The vault is no longer whole. The Frostwoven Mage—wretched traitor, spawn of Minax’s snowbound horrors—broke in two nights past, right through the warding glyphs.
He stole a tome: ‘Codex of Veins and Vapors.’ Not just any book—this one writes itself, feeding on the blood of anyone who dares carry it.
The Mage haunts the ice cliffs northeast of here, conjuring storms and sending living paragraphs to attack my scouts.
If you kill him, and bring me back the Codex… and proof of his demise…
I will reward you as only a true Archivist can. But be wary. Even a single page may try to slip into your thoughts, or your dreams."

Option.text: I’ll hunt the Frostwoven Mage and retrieve your Codex.
What does this Codex actually do?
Why did the Mage want it?
Are you sure it’s safe for me to handle?
Maybe this is above my skill. Farewell.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nolgrim’s eyes narrow with hope—and fear.
"Good. The cliffs northeast, near the old frozen runes. Beware illusions—the Mage will use your own memories against you.
If you see pages fluttering through the snow, burn them, do not read them.
Return with the Codex and something of the Mage—his staff, his heartstone, anything.
…And do not listen if the book whispers your name."

Option.text: I’ll return soon—with the Codex.

Dialogue.NPCText: "The Codex of Veins and Vapors is not a book—it is a *leech*. It records secrets in blood, and whoever carries it will feel their thoughts slipping onto the page. It can be read only once before the words rearrange themselves. In the wrong hands—especially Minax’s—it becomes a weapon. Or a curse."

Option.text: I’ll recover it and be careful.
Why would the Frostwoven Mage want it?
On second thought, I’ll leave it alone.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nolgrim shudders.
"That Mage was once one of us—a scholar, seduced by promises of power from beyond the ice. Minax’s agents lure the weak with new spells, forbidden histories, things mortals should not know.
With the Codex, he could scribe his own spells directly into flesh—create monsters, or perhaps rewrite his own fate. He must be stopped."

Option.text: You have my word—I’ll stop him.
Best leave this to someone else.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nolgrim’s lips twitch, grimly amused.
"Safe? No book worth reading is ever truly safe. But if you keep it closed and do not let the ink touch your skin, you should return with your mind intact.
Bring it swiftly, and I’ll reward you. Let it linger, and it may learn your name."

Option.text: Then I’ll act quickly.
I need to think this over.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nolgrim’s eyes grow distant, voice dropping to a wistful whisper.
"Before all this frost and fear? I was Nolgrim of Moonglow—the apprentice who read what others wouldn’t. I copied scrolls by candlelight, listened to professors drone, and dreamt of scripting spells that would outlive us all.

But curiosity is dangerous, here as anywhere. I… pushed too far. Perhaps you wish to hear which doors I opened that should have stayed shut?"

Option.text: What did you discover that got you exiled?
What drew you to study living ink and cursed tomes?
What hobbies or joys do you have, beyond books?
How did you meet Kaelen and Irinya?
That’s enough history for now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nolgrim’s hands tremble.
"In Moonglow, there are vaults under the Lyceum—the kind that even Archmages fear. I was tasked to transcribe a text called the ‘Ossuary Canticle.’
It… whispered back. I tried to warn them, but when pages began to move on their own and ink stained the Dean’s eyes, I was blamed. Banished. And the Canticle…? Still hungry, I wager."

Option.text: Did you keep any forbidden knowledge?
No wonder you’re so careful here.

DialogueFile.Dialogue:
He lowers his voice.
"I salvaged a single page, sewn into my shirt hem—still have it, though I dare not read it. When the wind howls from the east, it tries to wriggle free. If you possess SkillAtLeast:Magery,90, you might sense its power."

Dialogue.NPCText:
As you touch the page, a whisper curls through your mind: “The frost preserves, the ink remembers.”
Nolgrim snatches it back with shaking hands.
"Enough! Even now, the ink listens for weakness. You have talent—use it with care."

Option.text: Thank you for the warning.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nolgrim nods.
"Once burned, twice the scholar. Frostmere gave me a second chance, if not exactly a warm welcome. Here, at least, my paranoia is useful."

Option.text: Do you trust anyone here?
Let’s talk about something lighter.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He ponders.
"Trust? I trust Svala not to read my mail, Garrik to fix my hinges, and Irinya… to unsettle me. But true trust? That’s as rare as an unwritten page in this village."

Option.text: Understood. Let’s change the subject.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"The world is built from words as much as stone or bone. Living ink… it fascinated me from the moment I saw a rune pulse on its own. Some call it obsession; I call it survival.
Besides, who wouldn’t want their story to live forever—provided it doesn’t write back?"

Option.text: Do you ever regret your path?
That’s why you’re so wary of Kaelen, isn’t it?

Dialogue.NPCText:
He considers, then shakes his head.
"Regret is for poets and parents. I made my bed of runes; now I sleep in it. At least here, the dangers are honest—cold, hunger, and books with teeth."

Option.text: You have a point.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nolgrim sighs.
"Kaelen is young. He dreams of taming the unknown, but the unknown bites. I copy his notes because I fear what he might unleash—and so I might remember him, if he ever vanishes like so many before."

Option.text: Let’s talk about your interests outside the vault.
Thank you for your honesty.

Dialogue.NPCText:
A flicker of humor crosses his features.
"Even a scribe needs distractions. I carve puzzle boxes from driftwood, brew the best frostberry tea north of Minoc, and play—badly—the hammered dulcimer. Some say my music frightens away snow wolves. I call that a perk."

Option.text: Could you play for me?
What’s your favorite puzzle you’ve made?
That’s a relief—didn’t take you for a musician.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nolgrim hesitates, then draws a tiny dulcimer from a leather satchel. He taps a dissonant but oddly beautiful tune. The vault seems warmer for a moment.
(You feel your spirits rise.)

Option.text: Enjoy the moment.
That was lovely, thank you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
His eyes light up.
"Ah, the ‘Runic Box of Ten Locks’—unsolved by all but Svala, who then used it to trap a snow vole. I keep meaning to make another… if you’re clever, maybe you’d like to try?"
(If Int ≥ 90, you may attempt.)

Option.text: (If Int ≥ 90) Attempt to solve the puzzle.
I’ll leave that for Svala.

Dialogue.NPCText:
You deftly unlock the final catch. Nolgrim beams.
"Well! A mind as sharp as your sword. Take this token—a carved glyph for luck."
(You receive a Runic Luck Token.)

Option.text: Thank you.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Kaelen found me first, half-starved in a blizzard, and dragged me here—then pestered me for magical lessons. Irinya drifted in a few weeks later, full of riddles and wind. The three of us have little in common, except a fondness for secrets… and an inability to leave well enough alone."

Option.text: Do you work well together?
They both seem complicated.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nolgrim smirks.
"Work well? Sometimes. More often, we argue, then save each other’s lives, then argue again. A family, of sorts—just with fewer holidays."

Option.text: Thank you for sharing your story.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nolgrim pulls his shroud tighter.
"Enough of my history for now. There are still pages to guard, and secrets that bite. If you have other questions, or business in the vault, speak up before the shadows get restless."

Option.text: Let’s talk about something else.
Farewell for now.
